welcomeContent: This tutorial will guide you through the process of drawing, testing, and refining your font.
clickFirstChar: Let's start by creating your first letter. Click the 'A' card.
toolbarPenContent: This is the Pen tool. It is selected by default. You can use it to draw freehand shapes.
drawContent: Draw the shape of 'A' on this canvas. Take your time! The tutorial will wait for you. When you are finished drawing, click 'Next'.
clickBackToDashboard: Click Back to return to the dashboard.
clickAAgain: Select 'A' again to return to the editor.
clickTest: Great work! Now, let's see how it looks. Click the Test (flask) button.
testPageInput: This is the Test Page. You can type here to test how your font renders text.
closeTestPage: Click the Back button to close the test page.
clickNextForLowerA: Let's draw the lowercase 'a'. Click the Next Glyph arrow.
drawLowerA: Draw the 'a'. Notice how the curves work.
drawCharF: Draw the shape of 'F'. This is important because the next letter, 'E', uses this shape as a starting point.
toolSelectPan: The **Select Tool** is used to move, rotate, and scale paths. The **Pan Tool** is used to move the canvas view.
toolEraser: The **Eraser** removes parts of your drawing, and the **Slice Tool** cuts shapes into pieces.
actionUndo: Made a mistake? Use Undo/Redo or Copy/Paste.
actionGroup: Use Group to combine paths into a single object for easier moving.
clickNextForComposite: Let's see a powerful feature. Click Next to go to 'E'.
compositeExplanation: This is 'E'. It has been **pre-filled** with the shape of 'F'. You can now add strokes to finish the letter. Unlike linked glyphs, changes here are independent and won't affect the original 'F'.
drawComposite: Now, draw the bottom stroke to complete the 'E'. Notice how your new stroke combines with the pre-filled 'F' shape.
clickNextForLowerE: Let's create a lowercase 'e'. Click the Next Glyph arrow.
drawLowerE: Draw a simple 'e' on the canvas.
clickNextForLinked: Click Next again to see the magic of Linked Glyphs.
linkedExplanation: This is a combining mark. Notice it is already drawn! It is a **Linked Glyph** derived directly from the 'e' you just drew, scaled down automatically.
linkedStripNav: You can also navigate quickly between the Linked Glyph and its source components using this strip at the bottom.
transformLinked: Linked glyphs track the source shape, but their **position and size** are editable! Select the shape and try scaling or rotating it.
clickPrevForModification: Now, let's change the source. Click the **Previous Glyph** arrow to go back to 'e'.
modifyLowerE: Modify the 'e' significantly (e.g. add a circle around it).
clickNextToVerify: Go back to the linked glyph (Next).
verifyLink: See? The linked glyph updated automatically to match your changes!
clickNextForN: Let's explore **Smart Positioning**. Click Next to go to 'n'.
clickNextForTilde: Click Next to go to the Tilde mark.
clickNextForMacron: Click Next to go to the Macron.
drawMacron: Draw the Macron (¯). We need two marks to demonstrate how they sync.
positioningIntro: This is the **Positioning Editor**. Drag the Tilde on the canvas to place it correctly above the 'n'.
smartClassExpl: Look at the bottom strip. It shows **Related Pairs**. Tilde and Macron are in the same **Smart Class**, so positioning one updates the other automatically!
unlinkExpl: Need this specific pair to be different? Click **Unlink** to move this mark independently without affecting the Macron.
detachExpl: If you need to change the *shape* of the mark just for this letter (e.g. to squash it), click **Detach** to bake it into a new composite glyph.
explainCreator: Open the **Creator Studio** to create artwork, stickers, and social media posts using your font.
explainCompare: Use **Compare** to view multiple characters side-by-side. Useful for checking consistency.
explainSettings: Adjust global font settings, metadata (like designer name), and view metrics here.
explainExport: When you are ready, click **Export** to generate and download your installable OpenType (.otf) font file.
explainBack: Now, click **Back** to return to the Character Grid so we can explore the final tools.
finish: You are ready to create! Explore the other workspaces for Positioning and Kerning when you are done drawing.
hintGridSelect: Welcome! Select a character card to start drawing your font.
hintEditorDraw: The **Pen Tool** is active. Click and drag on the canvas to draw your character shape.
hintRelatedPairsContent: This pair belongs to a **Smart Class**. Any position changes you make here will automatically sync to all **Related Pairs** shown in this strip.
hintOverrideContent: Need a unique position for this specific pair? Click this button to **Unlink**. This creates an **Override**, allowing you to move this mark independently without affecting the rest of the class.
hintCompositeContent: This glyph is constructed from components. It has been pre-filled for you. You can edit the paths, or use the Refresh button to update it if the source components change.
hintLinkedContent: This is a Linked Glyph. Its shape is automatically constructed from other characters (e.g. Base + Mark). It updates live when the source characters change.
hintUnlinkContent: To edit the shape manually, you must **Unlink** it first. This breaks the connection to the source components and converts it to a standard glyph.
hintRelinkContent: You have unlinked this glyph. It is now independent. If you want to revert to the automatic shape, click the **Relink** button here. Note: This will discard your manual edits.
hintPositionedContent: This is a Positioned Pair. It is dynamically generated by placing a Mark relative to a Base character. You can adjust the position coordinates here.
hintDetachContent: Need to edit the shape itself? Click **Detach** to convert this live pair into an **Independent Glyph**. You can then edit the shape manually.
hintAcceptPosition: Looks good? Clicking **Accept** will save this default calculated position as correct.
hintKernedContent: This is a Kerned Pair. It represents a specific spacing adjustment between two characters.
hintAcceptKerning: Looks good? Clicking **Accept** will save this default calculated spacing as correct.
hintKerningWorkspaceContent: This is where character pairs can be adjusted to have custom spacing.
hintPositioningWorkspaceContent: This is where characters are positioned to create perfect alignment.
